npc_cohort_group.description: Corporations seem independent on the surface, but are all operating on delegated authority from Vorsiber Atomic, which owns everything in this region.
Gangs are ephemeral, with lifespans on the order of years rather than centuries. They're an alternative for people who can't hack it in the criminal syndicate or corporate worlds.

Criminal syndicates are one of the alternative power structures for citizens who have failed out of the primary corporate ladder. Syndicates are more volatile than corporations, since they are more likely to perceive threats as existential.
Metaphysical cults are more philosophically-oriented and aspire to become a full-blown religion.
Occult cults tend to be bizarre and eccentric, with beliefs on the supernatural.
Political cults believe their world view is the only correct one, and any means are justified to correct deviance.
Cults of personality are followers of a charismatic leader, or a group of leaders.
Having a shell company allows us to do things in a way that seems legitimate to outside observers.
A cult in your own image, how flattering.
Humans who admire you and help you change the city. They may follow your orders to some extent, or may be more independent.
A mixture of mechanical units that are either part of your consciousness or act independently and then even some humans or other animals.

Owns the bulk of northeast Asia, where our fair city is located. This region is temperate, and extremely rich in minerals. The Moscow Nuclear Exclusion Zone is irradiated, as are the war ruins surrounding the city.
The eleven MegaCorps that own the rest of what remains of Earth. They are in a state of cold war.
Some rebel groups seek change through nonviolent means.
Many rebel groups have decided to use drastic action to achieve their aims.
All life comes from the living stars, and will one day return to them. Our own star, Sol, is the Father of all earthborn life.

Our corner of the galaxy is shielded from turmoil by the Great Veil. The Veil supposedly protects us from the Dark Forest dangers of the galaxy. Incidentally, they also believe the Veil protects you from those who are below you. Hmm.
Life is fragile and precious. Humanity must nurture all other life, pruning the malignant only to promote the health of life on Earth.
Time is a coil, flowing inward and outward from a Sacred Singularity, the birth of God. The perception of time moving forward is but a reflection of eternity.
Earth is the Matron planet, and humans should neither leave her nor defile her.
The highest social class. They are guaranteed a living stipend and won't work unless in a managerial position.

The second-highest social class gets the important things done. They are doctors, scientists, postdoctoral engineers, or highly-credentialed professions like lawyers. They are strongly encouraged to work, but get a living stipend if they are unemployed.

The working class has a basic living stipend if they are unemployed, but it is rarely enough to cover rent and food. Debt tends to accrue in times of stress. Their landlords and employers, the federated corporations, take advantage of this class's vulnerability.
People without a two-year degree must work the lowest of jobs. Even with these job, money for food and housing is tough. Debt rates are high. The unemployed face eventual eviction.
Anyone may 'fail downwards' into the underclass. Rarely does anyone come back.
